The Science and Art of Using Telescopes (Patrick Moore's Practical Astronomy Series)
Springer | ISBN: 0387764690 | 2009-09-21 | PDF | 411 pages 


Amateur astronomers have to start somewhere. Most begin by buying a modest astronomical telescope and getting to know the night sky. After a while, many want to move on to the next stage, but this can be problematic. The trick is to choose the right equipment, and then use it to its fullest extent.

Observing Skills: The Science and Art of using Astronomical Telescopes provides the required information. First, it explains how to get the best from entry-level equipment (that upgrade may not even be needed for a year or two!).
